channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: LA faces 'extreme fire danger' as high winds forecast
item.description: Gusts are expected to kick up again early on Wednesday - as a 25th death is confirmed in the US disaster.

item.title: Fire-scarred Los Angeles has been given another rare warning
item.description: Millions of Southern Californians are on edge as a final round of dangerous fire weather is forecast for the region on Wednesday, along with a rare wa...

item.title: Marco Rubio to face senators at confirmation hearing for secretary of state
item.description: Sen. Marco Rubio, President-elect Donald Trump's pick for secretary of state, will face questions from his Senate colleagues on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Dozens arrested in India over alleged 5-year sexual abuse of teen girl
item.description: Authorities in southern India have detained almost 50 men suspected of repeatedly raping and sexually abusing a girl from the age of 13.

item.title: Federal prosecutors wonâ€™t seek charges in deadly arrest of Black motorist Ronald Greene
5 shot dead in Mexican town; body parts found in Gulf coast region
item.description: Five people were gunned down on the same street where another attack left eight dead just months earlier.

item.title: Impeached South Korean president detained over martial law declaration
item.description: South Korea's anti-corruption agency detains impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol over his brief declaration of martial law.

item.title: Gaza 'humanitarian zone' struck almost 100 times since May, BBC Verify finds
item.description: The area in Gaza which Israel's military has told people to go to "for their safety" has been hit by 97 strikes since May, BBC Verify analysis has rev...

item.title: Pistachio moguls and reservoirs: False water claims spread about California fires
item.description: Influencers and politicians are spreading false narratives about water and the L.A. wildfires. These include the idea that farm moguls took firefighti...

item.title: Pam Bondi, Trump's attorney general pick, to appear for confirmation hearing
item.description: Pam Bondi served as Florida's attorney general and represented President-elect Donald Trump during his first impeachment proceedings.

item.title: Relief, 21st-century style: As wildfires burn, GoFundMe becomes a repository of harrowing stories
Departing DHS Secretary Mayorkas contends he delivered border security in the end
item.description: As DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas prepares to leave office, NPR sits down for an exit interview. He tells us the border is more secure now than befo...

item.title: What happens if TikTok is banned by the US?
item.description: Could there be ways to bypass the ban - and could president-elect Donald Trump find a way to stop the law?

item.title: Mozambique's new president sworn in despite opposition boycott
item.description: Daniel Chapo's legitimacy has been questioned following protests against his victory.

item.title: Move aside BMI: There's a better way to define obesity, commission finds
item.description: An international committee of scientists has proposed changing the way obesity is defined and diagnosed. The proposal adds more ways to measure body c...

item.title: U.S. watchdog sues Capital One, alleging bank cheated customers out of $2 billion
item.description: The CFPB claims Capital One intentionally kept news of its higher-yield savings accounts from members with lower-yield savings accounts.

item.title: Why has it been so hard to arrest S Korea's impeached president?
item.description: Investigators had to scale ladders and cut through barbed wire to reach President Yoon's residence.

item.title: South Korean President Yoon detained after standoff over martial law decree
item.description: Yoon and his ruling party supporters remain defiant against the insurrection charges. He is South Korea's first sitting president to be detained.
